text: The women's long jump competition of the athletics events at the 1979 Pan American Games took place on 8 July at the Estadio Sixto Escobar. The defending Pan American Games champion was Ana Alexander of Cuba. ==Records== Prior to this competition, the existing world and Pan American Games records were as follows: {| class="wikitable" |- |World record | |7.09 |Prague, Czechoslovakia |August 29, 1978 |- |Pan American Games record | |6.63 |Mexico City, Mexico |1975 |} ==Results== All distances shown are in meters. {| class="wikitable" style="margin:0.5em auto; font-size:90%;position:relative;" width=68% |- |KEY: |align=center|WR||World Record |align=center|GR||Pan American Record |} ===Final=== {| class="wikitable sortable" |- !Rank !Name !Nationality !Distance !Notes |- | |Kathy McMillan | |6.46 | |- | |Ana Alexander | |6.31 | |- | |Eloína Echevarría | |6.27 | |- | |Diane Jones- Konihowski | |6.10 | |- | |Jane Frederick | |6.10 | |- | |Shonel Ferguson | |6.07 | |- | |Madeline de Jesús | |5.88 | |- | |Jillian Ross | |5.85 | |- | |Jennifer Innis | |5.56 | |- |10 |Yvonne Neddermann | |5.54 | |- |11 |Nancy Valecilla | |5.29 | |- | |Themis Zambrzycki | | | |- | |Sharol Henry | | | |- | |Dorothy Scott | | | |- | |Sorelli Bohorquez | | | |} ==References== Category:Athletics at the 1979 Pan American Games 1979
title: Athletics at the 1979 Pan American Games – Women's long jump
